column1: Name:PM2.5-Attributable Cardiovascular Hospitalizations (Adults 40 Yrs and Older)
column3:
How Calculated:

Estimate is based on the number of hospitalizations for cardiovascular causes associated with the difference in air quality for indicator years relative to natural background (modeled air quality levels under no man-made air pollution emissions). Estimate is calculated using the acute risk of hospitalizations for all cardiovascular causes from the Ito K et al 2010 study conducted on New York City residents above 40 years of age
column4: Source(s):New York State Statewide Plann US EPA Air Quality System; Ito

column1: Name:PM2.5-Attributable Cardiovascular Hospitalizations (Adults 40 Yrs and Older)
column3:
How Calculated:

Estimate is based on the number of hospitalizations for cardiovascular causes associated with the difference in air quality for indicator years relative to natural background (modeled air quality levels under no man-made air pollution emissions). Estimate is calculated using the acute risk of hospitalizations for all cardiovascular causes from the Ito K et al 2010 study conducted on New York City residents above 40 years of age. Neighborhood estimates expressed as annual cases per 100000 residents over 40 years of age.
column4: Source(s):New York State Statewide Plann US EPA Air Quality System; Ito

column1: NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene
